commands.name: az network vpn-connection create
commands.syntax:
az network vpn-connection create --name
                                 --resource-group
                                 --vnet-gateway1
                                 [--authorization-key]
                                 [--egress-nat-rule]
                                 [--enable-bgp]
                                 [--express-route-circuit2]
                                 [--express-route-gateway-bypass {false, true}]
                                 [--ingress-nat-rule]
                                 [--local-gateway2]
                                 [--location]
                                 [--routing-weight]
                                 [--shared-key]
                                 [--tags]
                                 [--use-policy-based-traffic-selectors {false, true}]
                                 [--validate]
                                 [--vnet-gateway2]
examples: az network vpn-connection create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyConnection --vnet-gateway1 MyVnetGateway --local-gateway2 MyLocalGateway --shared-key Abc123

az network vpn-connection create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyConnection --vnet-gateway1 MyVnetGateway --local-gateway2 MyLocalGateway --shared-key Abc123 --ingress-nat-rule /subscriptions/000/resourceGroups/TestBGPRG1/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworkGateways/gwx/natRules/nat

az network vpn-connection create --location westus2 --name MyConnection --resource-group MyResourceGroup --shared-key Abc123 --vnet-gateway1 MyVnetGateway --vnet-gateway2 /subscriptions/{subscriptionID}/resourceGroups/TestBGPRG1/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworkGateways/VNet1GW
az network vpn-connection create --local-gateway2 MyLocalGateway --location westus2 --name MyConnection --resource-group MyResourceGroup --shared-key Abc123 --vnet-gateway1 MyVnetGateway

commands.name: az network vpn-connection delete
commands.syntax:
az network vpn-connection delete [--ids]
                                 [--name]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--resource-group]
                                 [--subscription]
examples: az network vpn-connection delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyConnection

commands.name: az network vpn-connection list
examples: az network vpn-connection list -g MyResourceGroup --vnet-gateway MyVnetGateway

commands.name: az network vpn-connection list-ike-sas
commands.summary: List IKE Security Associations for a VPN connection.
commands.syntax:
az network vpn-connection list-ike-sas [--ids]
                                       [--name]
                                       [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                       [--resource-group]
                                       [--subscription]
examples: az network vpn-connection list-ike-sas -g MyResourceGroup -n MyConnection

commands.name: az network vpn-connection show
commands.summary: Get the details of a VPN connection.
examples: az network vpn-connection show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyConnection

commands.name: az network vpn-connection show-device-config-script
commands.summary: Get a XML format representation for VPN     connection device configuration script.
examples: az network vpn-connection show-device-config-script -g MyResourceGroup -n MyConnection --vendor "Cisco" --device-family "Cisco-ISR(IOS)" --firmware-version "Cisco-ISR-15.x-- IKEv2+BGP"

commands.name: az network vpn-connection update
commands.syntax:
az network vpn-connection update [--add]
                                 [--enable-bgp {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--express-route-gateway-bypass {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--ids]
                                 [--name]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--remove]
                                 [--resource-group]
                                 [--routing-weight]
                                 [--set]
                                 [--shared-key]
                                 [--subscription]
                                 [--tags]
                                 [--use-policy-based-traffic-selectors {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network vpn-connection update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyConnection --enable-bgp True
az network vpn-connection update --name MyConnection --resource-group MyResourceGroup --use-policy-based-traffic-selectors true

commands.name: az network vpn-connection wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
